summary: The Neighborhood Homes Investment Act proposes a new tax credit to incentivize neighborhood revitalization by encouraging the development and rehabilitation of affordable homes in distressed communities. The bill outlines the criteria for qualified residences, development costs, and eligible homeowners, as well as the responsibilities of neighborhood homes credit agencies. It also includes provisions for credit allocation, repayment, and reporting. The amendments will apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
